title: Is it true that without civilization or rules humans would have no moral values? (Like in the Lord of the Flies) - Quora

response.answer_text: Well to get it out of the way first, the book “Lord of the Flies”always struck me as a somewhat unbalanced portrayal of mankind. It is a powerful allegory for society, yes, but it is leaving all the elements out that don’t fit the author’s theory. In this book everyone who is good is completely useless in some way and the capable ones were completely evil and only wanted to paint their faces and kill. So, it should be no surprise that I disagree with the premise that corruption is inherent in human nature and when there are no rules to follow, we will either be evil or useless, beause of our sense of morality (or lack thereof). We are always both, good and bad, and thus have the ability to swing either way. Civilisation, rules, morality is not something external forced on us, we, the humans build it for us. (Even animals who live in packs have rules) Rules and morals have always been present, in all cultures at all times, they just changed as times changed. I am not saying, that some humans (or even most) will not behave completely out of control once you remove the veneer of civility. They will. But history has proven time and time again that we will inevitably swing back to the state of setting up rules and enforcing them again, and re-establish whatever morality we follow, based on the current cultural values and obligations. Thanks for the request.

I have a simple answer: If humans had the exact same moral values they wouldn’t need rules because clarity or not, empathy would probably render a balanced equality. We wouldn’t have to question civilization in this instance. On the other hand, it’s extremely broad. Without civilization moral values would differ, without rules there would be repeated misfortune due to inexperience youth and no concept of abstinence. Rules can go as far as to say - don’t pick that fruit yet as it hasn’t ripened. If it were rules that gave us moral values, else not; we’d all be sociopaths or we’d freeze frame unable to decide what to do because no morals would have value precedence over others. If I carried on I’d have to eventually say moral values are integral to human functionality in socialist survival, tribal or societal as we know it, and without them we’d have to consider the conclusion of not-human. Who’s to know what would succeed as necessaries to these psychological and psychiatric fixed, flux, and absent attributes between FFF and physical and environmental adaptations either? Endlessness intertwining presumptuousness.
